topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack® Carrier Grade (Alpha): Create the HP VSC Node

body.p: The HP Virtualized Services Controller (HP VSC) is a component of HP Distributed Cloud Networking. HP VSC functions as the robust network control plane for DCs, maintaining a full view of pertenant network and service topologies.
HP VSC must run on a dedicated hardware server as the only virtual machine process, called the HP VSC Node.
Use the following steps to install the HP VSC node in the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade cloud.
Note: You can download the complete HP Distributed Cloud Networking manuals, in needed.

section.title: Create the VSC node VM
section.p: To create the VM that hosts the VSC node:

li.p: Copy the vsc_singledisk.qcow2 to the /var/lib/libvirt/images folder on your kvm host.
Use the following commands to create a virtual machine (the HP VSC node) from the VSC XML definition file then start the domain:

codeblock.codeph: virsh define vsc.xml virsh autostart vsc virsh start vsc

section.title: Configure the VSC node
section.p: Once your VM is up and running, use the following steps to configure the VSC node:

li.p: Connect to the HP VSC console using libvirt:
HP VSC should boot to a login prompt on the console
Log in to the console using the default credentials:
Use the following steps to edit the Boot Options File (BOF) configuration.
The HP VSC uses a Boot Options File (BOF) named bof.cfg that is read on system boot and is used for some basic, low-level system configuration needed to successfully boot the HP VSC.
a. Navigate to the Boot Options File context:
The prompt will indicate a change to the bof context
b. Enter the Management IP address:
c. Enter the primary DNS IP address,
Example: primary-dns 10.10.10.25
d. Enter the name of the DNS domain,
Example: helion.cg
e. Enter the static routes for the management IP network
f. Save the configuration to cf1. The bof.cfg file be saved to the cf1: user emulated disk.
g. Exit the configuration.
Configure NTP using the console:
a. Enter the following commands to enter the NTP server configuration:
b. Enter the IP addresses for NTP servers:

codeblock.codeph:
server <IP_address> no shutdown
Example: server 10.10.10.25 server 10.1.64.20 no shutdown

li.p: f. Exit the NTP server configuration:
g. Shutdown the SNTP service:
j. Specify the time zone:
k. Complete the NTP configuration:
Configure Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol (XMPP). HP VSC communicates with the HP VSD policy engine using Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol (XMPP).
a. Enter the following commands to enter the xmpp server configuration:
b. Specify the xmpp server (xmpp.example.com) and username (NSC-vPE-1) and password:
c. Complete the XMPP configuration:
Save the configurations:
Check that the XMPP server is properly configured:

codeblock.codeph:
admin display-config
-------------------------------------------------- echo "Virtual Switch Controller Configuration" -------------------------------------------------- vswitch-controller xmpp-server "vsc:password@vsd.helion.cg" open-flow exit xmpp exit exit --------------------------------------------------

li.p: Save the configuration to cf1. The bof.cfg file be saved to the cf1: user emulated disk.
Verify that IP addresses and routes have been added to the configuration file:
Check the command output for the appropriate IP addresses, such as Management and DNS addresses and static routes.
Verify that you can ping the CLM network on the HLM node:
Log in to the HP Networks Virtualized Services Directory Architect (VSD Architect) UI in a browser from Guest VM as the CSP administrator.
The default CSP administrator login:

codeblock.codeph: User Name: csproot Password: csproot Organization: csp

li.p: After login, the Organization Dashboard is displayed.
The VSD and VSC VMs should have a green bar.

section.title: Useful commands for VSC
section.p: You might find the following commands helpful when working with VSC.

li.p: Set specific values for parameters below

codeblock.codeph: configure system time ntp server 10.1.64.20 configure system name "VSC" configure system sntp server-address configure system time zone UTC configure vswitch-controller xmpp-server "vsc:password@test.nuage.cdl.local"

li.p: Verify these setting

codeblock.codeph: show system ntp show system information - to displays System Name show system sntp - to display sntp server ip address show system time show switch-controller xmpp-server - to display the name of XMPP server, FQDN and username, number of XMPP servers

li.p: Check the settings:

codeblock.codeph: admin display-config show system ntp detail
